intro: Oldenlandia chiovendae, commonly known as the Madagascar spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
